text: NASCAR will decide its 2014 Sprint Cup
championship with a new elimination
style format six-time champion Jimmie
Johnson stopped by the New York Times to
explain how it works
the new rules just add a ton of
excitement to the sport we have had our
regular season we have the 16 drivers
that are eligible for the championship
and we have three race blocks that kind
of take place so after each race is done
or after the three races are done four
drivers are eliminated we start with 16
we go down to 12 we go down to 8 and
then for the last race in Homestead
Florida four drivers are eligible for
the championship the way that you
transfer is a win gives you an automatic
berth into the next round and then after
that any spots that are open and
available go to the next driver highest
and points that has not won so it will
have the cream of the crop in you know
moving on to each through each segment
and then we get to Homestead and that's
where it's so different in fun we have
four drivers with an equal opportunity
to win the championship which is brand
new to our sport are there any concerns
about this format that I won't win oh
that's my only concern about the format
I want to win I want to be the champion
it's Ruth FLE if drivers and teams
aren't overly happy about the
championship or some maybe some may not
I think it's gonna be very exciting so
it doesn't bother me it's really about
the fans what the fans want to see what
the fans find exciting what kind of
pressure is there as the defending
champion defending champion is a little
different in its it's not easy but it's
easier than trying to win your first you
know the pressure that's on you to win
your first championship is so intense
and you've worked your whole life to be
in that position team as well sponsor
it's it's it's a ton of pressure so when
the team of this year in a different
format would be insane
love to be the first at doing things but
more importantly to me is I would tie
Dale Earnhardt senior and Richard Petty
for the most championships won a NASCAR
so it is top of mind for me and
regardless of format
I just want to join those greats and
then ultimately someday hopefully pass
them but first things first and I want
to I want to be the third driver with
seven championships
Oh
Oh
